website_summaries.verdict: A tough fishing line that gives you a smooth cast and makes it easy to hold onto your big catch.
pros: Line doesn't get stiff, so your cast is always smooth
Won't get tangled on the spool
cons: The dye on the line rubs off easily

customer_reviews.title: great line for surf fishing
customer_reviews.text: great line for ocean fishing. this is for your main line , just add a light leader and pow FISH ON. Castro camp in Baja, mexico, using kastking 65# SuperPower braided line with 40# leader. i caught this Seabass it weighed 62# after gill and gutted. Just got lucky. pervious years I've gotten 30's and 40's but never bigger. this line was fantastic. TommyTuna
customer_reviews.author: Tommy M. Segawa

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first because of the low price of this line. But after a full season using this on Lake Michigan and landing a substantial number of 20+ pound monsters, I'm completely sold! Not 1 break off the entire season. The color fades after time, but the fish don't seem to care. I now have 26 rods with this line on them. I use it for backing on lead core rods and spool up the downrigger and dipsy rods fully and then use a fluorocarbon leader. To do this with the name brand stuff is relatively expensive and I now see no reason to invest in anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Braid
customer_reviews.text: I use KastKing on all my gear for fishing here in Southern California. With a short topshot, this braid has cut thru lots of kelp while fighting yellowtail off my kayak. I've used this braid when it was just called Eposeidon and not KastKing, and I'll keep using it for as long as I fish. For the quality at the price, it cant be beat. I started off using this line on my surf reels but now all my reels have it. I use 20lb on my sabiki, 50lb for my Sealine SHA X-40 and 65lb on my TLD 15. Best line I've ever used, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Ceruleandrms

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good line same ss spiderwire and the price even better...!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex otoya

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Super tough string. Resist abrasions as good as anything I've tried
customer_reviews.author: Mistro

customer_reviews.title: No more broken fishing lines!!! Landing monster fish with KastKing Braid!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using KastKing superpower braid for about three years now. It is so tough and amazingly durable. I continually have fish wrap me around pylons from the pier structures i fish and i always am able to pull fish after fish off the pylons with no problems what so ever. This line has changed my fishing life!! I rarely ever break any fish off anymore and the braid is extremely affordable. No more spending the big bucks on power pro and spider wire! Greatest plus, they have pink braid...and its been tested, pink braid catches more fish!
customer_reviews.author: TangGoat

customer_reviews.title: Line broke on second cast.
customer_reviews.text: Update. I finally got around to using this line and I don’t recommend it. I had Carolina rig on with a 2 ounce weight. Two casts and the line just broke on the second cast. Had that been a fish on the line and it broke, I would not be happy. Spend a couple more dollars for a better fishing line. Good for the price but it’s super thick and heavy for the same weight class. Probably won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vkk

customer_reviews.title: Bought 30lb, keeps breaking at 20lb.....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 30lb low vis green and it came on time. I decided to test the breaking strength with different knots and lengths and to my surprise it was breaking consistently at 20lb! Im really dispointed at this purchase because of the failure of the braid despite all the good reviews. Maybe I received a 20lb spool marked 30lb? I hope it was a mislabeling and not a quality issue. If someone from the company can contact me that would be great.Until then my review stands at 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Lilah Love

customer_reviews.title: Color bleeds, thicker than advertised, casts poorly, loud retrieval.
customer_reviews.text: My spool rated at 660 yds of a larger braid, was overfilled with the 500 and some change that comes in the package.(40lb its thick like string) It's overtly loud on cast and retrieval. Casting a 2oz egg sinker on a fish finder rig with an 8ft star rod I get about 30yds from a pier! It seems the heavier kast king braids would be more appropriate overpowering catfish or sewing up tears in canvas. Setup: 1 piece 8ft star stellar, daiwa BG 8000, 40lb kast king 500yds. To show I'm not biased I do use the smaller 20 lb cast king on my 4000 Shimano Saros and it works great. Anything larger I would be wary of.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Berryman

customer_reviews.title: Nice line
customer_reviews.text: So far so good stood up to a nice fight with a 24" Red fish. Cast well one tangle all day.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how good this line is??
customer_reviews.text: Have issues with this line. Sent email to support and have not heard back. There are sections of line that look defective. This is right off a new 1000yd spool. Will update if manufacturer replies.
customer_reviews.author: unclet

customer_reviews.title: Watch the thickness, good line though.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 15lb and 30lb test SuperPower Braid fishing line. The 15 is excellent. I've been using KastKing for a while now and never had a problem with it. When I went to spool the 30lb test line I noticed it was very thick. I measured it and by their specs it was the thickness of their 50lb line obviously mislabeled as 30lb. Even though I had waited beyond the return period at Amazon to look at it, when I contacted KastKing they agreed to replace or refund which they did promptly. Because of this I still recommend them and will purchase from them again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Kastking Braid - Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Kastking 25# braid Line snapped during the first time that I used it due to apparent quality defect so I am returning both spools. I lost $30 in terminal tackle (dipsey diver and trolling spoon) and wouldn't trust it to haul a fish. I'll spend a few extra dollars and buy power pro or fire line.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Janish

customer_reviews.title: Light And Strong--Very Low Visibility In The Water--Knots Really Hold
customer_reviews.text: This is my first use of braided line and I have to say I really like it. I bought the Low-vis Gray and pair it with a fluorocarbon leader setup. The entire rig pretty much absolutely disappears once in the water. I fish primarily along the Northern California coast from shore, boat and (sometimes) piers. Winding it onto your reel is a bit different than monofilament line as it requires a slightly different technique and more tension on the line while winding. There are several YouTube videos that deal with this and I recommend watching at least a couple. If you want to give braided a try, I recommend this brand for its quality. And the price is certainly reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Thorne HamstringTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Just Right For A-rigs
customer_reviews.text: I deleted my review which was very upbeat on Kastking braids after having bought it in several different pound tests. Not crazy about braid in general anymore because it isn't ideal for my fishing conditions from a rocky shoreline at my lake. Even with a leader it's just too many problems and too many lost big fish. However , the 80 pound test that I bought works like a dream for A-Rigs(umbrella rigs). This was a bargain. It has approximately the same thickness as 20 pound mono and ties on and casts with the heavy rigs just great. Pretty good price for something to throw them with that I trust with 20-40 dollars worth of tackle.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Line breaks at half of what it is advertised as.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 65# line to fill 400 yards on a FinNor OFS8500 reel for saltwater jigging. The reel has a max drag of 60 pounds. I tested the line for strength. I did 8 tests and the average breaking strength was 31 pounds. Less than half of what it is advertised for. I also purchased 80# for a FinNor OFS9500 and tested the breaking strength several times. It broke at an average of 37 pounds. The line broke between the knots, not at the knots. In spooling these reels it left a very messy grey residue on my fingers and also on the rod guides. This line is crap. I removed the KastKing crap and replaced it with PowerPro.
customer_reviews.author: JSchofield

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Value for Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Power Pro Braid and decided to try the KastKing primarily because the KastKing is much less expensive. I am very happy that I made the switch. The KastKing line performs better than the Power Pro in all categories from my point of view. It is more flexible and cast much farther. The only unanswered question is how long the color will last. All braids seem to fade rather quickly so I will just have to wait an see about the KastKing since I have only been using it for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Haddock

customer_reviews.title: Good product but lacking Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Ive used kastking braid many times, while they are definitely a great set of lines, Kastking really needs to focus in Quality Control if they want to be in the same conversation with PowerPro and Spiderwire. Perfect example of poor QC is this knot on the braid I just purchased. Kastking if you are reading this, fire your QC line and send me a replacement ASAP. For goodness sake, please! Update---- Changed from 2 to 1 star for poor customer service. I have not heard back from Kastking regarding my issue. Kastking if you are reading this, please contact me. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sobe

customer_reviews.title: Kastking, what more needs said?
customer_reviews.text: Being a beginner baitcaster, I bought an affordable rod and reel combo, watched my YouTube videos on how to use it properly, and went shopping for an interim, inexpensive braided fishing line. I used it for an entire season. Next season, when it came time to change line, I bought it again, as it was some of the most durable line I have used. It did everything it said it would, and did it reliably! What more can you ask of any product?
customer_reviews.author: Lucky L. Knesal

customer_reviews.title: A good basic braid
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent braid for the price, however, I much prefer some of Kastking's other braids. The 30 lb. braid is as thick as the other Kastking 40 lb braid which hurts both the amount you can put on your reel and casting distance. Usually 30 lb. braid is equivalent to 8 lb mono, but this braid is equivalent to the diameter of 10 lb mono. Obviously you can still hold a lot more line than if actually using mono and still cast much farther but not as far as if it was had the equivalent of 8 lb. mono. Overall, it's a good value, long lasting and less expensive alternative but not my favorite Kastking product.
customer_reviews.author: Steelhead

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for? Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased March 2018. I have never used braided line until this line. I used this all summer before posting my review. It was spooled on a Johnny Morris carbon elite spinning reel. That's approximately 6 months of you on rocky river banks in upstate New York. Not once did this line let me down. It never broke or gave me wind knots. The memory of this line is minimal to none. I didn't have many issues with fraying from rubbing on rocks. I never lost a fish or lure due to this line. My reel was spooled in the beginning of summer and I haven't had to respool yet. I will definitely buy more of this product for other reels.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndon Durgan

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the quality control I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed like it was gonna be a good braid. I spooled one reel with it and while spooling the second one I noticed a long section that just didn't feel right. Upon further inspection it seems like the braid didn't get woven right. It had a rough feeling and was stiffer than the rest of the braid. Another thing I noticed is that the color of the braid fades to white after 2 trips of casting lures in the surf. I will give them another chance to see if I might have gotten a dud spool.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Its braid
customer_reviews.text: Good braided line but tangles like crazy. First time out I think I spent 5 minutes between casts figuring out what happened to my line. I eventually returned it when my wife who was using mono was catching fish while my line is hanging out in the lake and I am trying to figure out how it turned into a three line mega knot. It is expensive but it is strong. If you can make it through the initial tangling it seems to get a little better the more fish you can catch on it
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sherman

customer_reviews.title: It's just that particular dye,changed to a new color with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this 20# braided line but after a week of putting it through it's Pace's,I'm truly disappointed. First off,I noticed severe bleeding of dye while spooling and it got much worse upon using it...gunk gets everywhere. On my first cast it seemed very rough and retrieval wasn't much better. Worst braid I've ever used... YouTube reviews raved about this stuff....sorry to say I will not use this product again...going back to spider wire! :Update:I've upgraded this to 4 stars due to improved performance after break-in period...at least in my opinion...I think it's just that particular dye color because I just spooled up #30 blue braid by kastking with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Spooled a reel up with kastking 20 lb braid. Had several wind knots, 3 major ones, even though there was not much wind. It does cast pretty good and durability is ok. I had 2 rods with the same reel (piscifun). One rod had J-braid and one had kastking. I had a 1/8 oz Owner Weighted Twistlock Hook and a jerk shad plastic lure I was throwing. I will try with a heavier lure setup and see what happens. That's my initial look. I will update review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: ISHMAIL

customer_reviews.title: Spent 30 minutes cleaning up my gear from this garbage product
customer_reviews.text: I got a brand new rod and reel and decided to try out some braided line. Granted this stuff is cheaper but wow this stuff was terrible. I lost two lures from the line snapping as a result of the line leaving a sticky bluish black residue all over my gear wherever the line touched. Even the eyelets were coated in that residue where there should be little to no friction. The residue caused so much friction that the line kept snapping, hence the lost lures. I had to clean every piece of my gear off where this line touched it. I honestly do not understand how this stuff is so highly rated.
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: Good braid for the price.  Smooth and solid.
customer_reviews.text: I've used to product for close to a month now and have it on 4 of my reels. It's great for all purpose inshore saltwater fishing. It's smooth on my KastKing baitcaster I bought and also on three of my spinning reels. It's a solid choice for anybody on a budget that wants a decent braid. I give it 5 stars based on the price and the overall performance of the braid. I've limited out already multiple times on speckled trout and redfish. In fact, the braid hasn't broken one time and very little fray. Can't wait to use it a few months from now for flounder.
customer_reviews.author: Philip G.

customer_reviews.title: Too thick. It might work as anchor line or clothes line, but don’t buy this to fish with.
customer_reviews.text: This is rope, not fishing line. I took it with me on a trip as a back up and when I needed it, I discovered the 50lb braid I bought was so thick, my Fin nor reel couldn’t handle it at all. I couldn’t cast with it and couldn’t even reel it in. And it is so thick, I was only able to put a small amount on my reel. It is as thick as 50 lb flouro. It is garbage. Do not buy this. I will try to get my money back but I think I got screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonviolin

customer_reviews.title: Best brand on the market
customer_reviews.text: Husband took this deep sea halibut and lingcod fishing; used on a 5 1/2 foot halibut rod with electric reel. Veteran fisherman thought he was using 100Lb+ test line when they got caught on the bottom at 1500+ feet because they couldn’t get the line to snap and break (which they had previously had to do with another guys line that got caught). We love everything we’ve bought from KastKing and we continuously buy from them because value for quality of product is way better than anything you can buy at Cabela’s or bass pro as well as other brands online.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Trying to determine if I’ll buy again
customer_reviews.text: Strength is equivalent to the rating and it knots well. My only complaint is it seems to eat into itself when it goes back onto the reel or it sticks to itself after drying. I always rinse with freshwater after every trip. I have a spinning reel. Maybe I can spray something on it, not sure. I wound up with a really nasty birds nest (tangle) after a 2nd cast yesterday. I had to cut about half off. I’ve never had this happen on a spinning reel, though I have heard of it. There was no wind at the time. I may try something with a slick coating or just use mono.
customer_reviews.author: jola rayco

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong, definitely has memory
customer_reviews.text: The line (25# in my case) is fairly weak. When when cinching a knot, it seems to stretch. I’ve also had several kinks in the braid and noticed it has plenty of spool memory after just one fish. I had one spinner bait break off the line just from the weight of a little grass and lost it. This was probably only 30 casts after spooling my reel so it didn’t hold up long at all.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great value for performance
customer_reviews.text: Being a long time powerpro user, it was time to purchase new braid for my spools. I mainly fish saltwater from the beach and kayak. I read a bunch of reviews and decided to try out the 30# Kastking and was impressed. I have landed reds, rays, and trout from the beach with no breakoffs. Bought the 20# for my kayak rods, have not had any issues with windknots or any random breakoffs so far with one season of fishing in. For the price and value I’ll likely purchase this again next time I need new braid, no complaints here but only have had experience with 30# and 20#.
customer_reviews.author: Jay T

customer_reviews.title: Does not cast very far compared to my other braid.
customer_reviews.text: There is a coating on this braid that will come off on your fingers when you spool the line on to your reel. It seems to makes the line heavy, and not cast as well as my other 20lb braid. Spooled on Penn Battle II 4000 reel. I had to pull it off and went back to my old brand of braid, but will us it on a dead stick rod fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McClure

customer_reviews.title: Great price and it works
customer_reviews.text: The price for a line is a great deal and the color options are great too. The reason for the 4 stars is because the line didn’t seem to do good around reefs and cause some snap offs the next day which was very frustrating after I took the time to make a quality rig. Reefs are incredibly sharp so under normal circumstances the line should be perfect. The line is also cheap so buy the extra spools and re-spool here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Color is such a useful guide for newbies!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty new to fishing, so having multi-colored braid really helps me understand what depth I'm fishing at. If one position in the water column is working for me, I can stick at that consistently. This braid is as good as any other I've tried and is holding up well. I've caught a lot of fish on it so far, in any case, and only break I've had is when a pretty big shark pulled the line against the ladder at the stern of the boat I was fishing from. Other than that, no issues. I'll continue to purchase this item as necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Best Braid for the Price - Great all around
customer_reviews.text: Amazing braid for the price... Beat out powerpro in our own experience, in functionality, knot strength, and overall castability. Now using their Super9 braid (freaking incredible) and have this as our backup line in the tackle box. Have never been so pleased for the price and quality...and made me very aware of how much price gouging happens with "marketing"... The color (hi-vis yellow) does fade quickly, yet that seems a universal thing with all lines. Great job Eposeidon/KastKing. You have two new dedicated fishermen...(myself and wife) :) Wife's near state record bowfin/dogfish was a lightning bolt..no issues.. My buffalo carp was massive, no line issues.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: The only Braid I will ever buy again. I pull trees out of ponds.
customer_reviews.text: I typically use 12 or 15 lb line.. this stuff is by far the best. I do alot of frog fishing too. I don't need heavy braid 50-60# like pros suggest. 12-15# KastKing SuperPower and work the drag and the fish.. I've pulled 5 foot Christmas trees out of ponds andnlakes with this stuff. No joke. Legit line.
customer_reviews.author: A~DuB

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Beats power pro.
customer_reviews.text: Just buy it! I was super skeptical based on the price. My first purchase was 15# to try for a light tackle salt water my flounder/fluke reel, well it has held up way past my expectations. I have caught multiple 30 plus pound striped bass, giant blue fish and fluke. I can’t believe I was buying power pro braid for so many years. This stuff has held up great, no breaks offs or no wind knots. It’s easy to tie. It does fade slightly but most lines do. This is my new go to line, just bought more 20# and telling everyone about it.
customer_reviews.author: kelly whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Cost is great. Only downside is the colored coating is very ...
customer_reviews.text: Breaking strength is on the mark. Cost is great. Only downside is the colored coating is very easy to rub off and the casting isn't as smooth as I'd like. I like to fish on my lunch breaks and it is slightly annoying to have green/gray fingers after lunch. The smoothness of the line is less of an issue for me since I usually use this line for fishing in heavy cover, but sometimes when I need more distance it's just a little hard to get. I might try the 20lbs braid and see how that does in terms of casting smoothness.
customer_reviews.author: Errol K

customer_reviews.title: You know what they say about first impressions...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first experience with braided fishing line at my brother's recommendation and a couple others, and I am not impressed. I put it on one of my baitcast reels and the green color bled all over my hands. I got severe backlash on more than one occasion and had hell getting it untangled. The line seemed slow in the water. A few other reasons too but I'm not a fan. I'll stay with mono & flouro. On the plus side this line won't break. It is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Decent braided line
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to braided line, this will be a good starter braid. It is very durable, just try an cut it. One thing I did notice is that it has a big diameter. I noticed that it really took up a lot of the spool when I spooled the reel. This is compared to other braided lines of this size. I would suggest KastKing add some type of teflon coating to the braid because I noticed that when this line got wet it had a higher percentage of backlash and would have a tendency to dig into the spool. I was still pleased with my purchase and I would recommend this as an entry level braided line.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell M.

customer_reviews.title: Great company but if you want thinner go with a pound test or two lower if u want thinner line.
customer_reviews.text: It's bad the thirty pound line feels like 50lb or greater and is significantly thicker than the traditional 30lb braid by other companies. When I've ordered the 8-20lb from this same company and braid, the line was so significantly thinner. So you can see when I got this I was disappointed. I feel like the braid that was spooled onto this spindle was misplaced onto a thinner braided lines spool by mistake. But we shall see not what I planned on wanting or having. Now I've gotta spend more money to get the thinner line I truly wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Andy C.

customer_reviews.title: Best affordable braid yet.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed by this KastKing braid. Smooth casting, durable, clips easy. Knots hold great. There are plenty of inexpensive braid that work well, but the Kastking is the first for me that excels. One unadvertised feature: If you accidentally let the line loop around your thumb and lose your grip on a big fish this line will slice through you like a hot knife through butter, allowing them to pull an easy 10 yards of line in no time. This big boy almost got away with the top half of my left thumb. Good thing because this line is more than worth 2 thumbs up and it would have been a shame to only have 1 to give.
customer_reviews.author: ND Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great line in general
customer_reviews.text: Great line in general. Here I am with a striped bass on. 20lb test. So far it’s been great . I rated it a 4 not a five because I find sometimes the line gets caught on the reel and it seems to tangle. Don’t know why. Generally it forms a loop under line that’s already been retrieved. Sometimes a loop wraps around or overlaps on the spool of the real. Could be me , don’t know. Line’s been great in general. Very happy with it do far. Have fished with it a couple dozen times already.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Giombetti

customer_reviews.title: Better than SpiderWire
customer_reviews.text: I have been using spider wire for the past four years. I decided to try this based on reviews. I am quite impressed. Aside from the color coming off on my fingers when loading it on my bait-caster, this product is amazing! I have already caught more salmon this year than the last two years combined; it is so sensitive and strong. So far, after two days on the river, the line has shown no signs of wear and casts so much smoother than Spider-wire; doesn't make as much noise when reeling in either. Great product, will definitely buy it again and suggest it to others!
customer_reviews.author: Washington Rain Camper

customer_reviews.title: First time using Braided line
customer_reviews.text: We are taking our grand kids on vacation in June. They love to fish so I bought 2 new collapsible rods and two reels for the kids. For me a bought a new Jaws Baitkaster and I wanted a to make sure the line I bought would hold up to the large mouth bass. After reading the reviews, I deiced to go with the KastKing Braided fishing line. I have not got a chance to use yet, so I will come back and review the stability once I get chance to try it out. Best Greg
customer_reviews.author: Greg B

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on lines rated 8-lb and below.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both 6 and 8-lb rated lines for my brook trout tackle since I had a great experience with the heavier lines rated 60-lbs and above for salt water fishing. That was a mistake. I quickly learned that these particular braided lines (in the lighter ratings) do not behave nor perform anything like their big brothers. They are more difficult to work with, as well as break and abrade very easily. Tangling and knotting is also an problem, too. While there are advantages and performance benefits of using braided lines in the heavier ratings, they do not carry over to light tackle. Stay with a monofilament.
customer_reviews.author: RNR

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!!!
customer_reviews.text: Kept having the bigger cats snap our lines in the pond. I've always liked monofilament but it just wasn't enough, and the good high poundage takes up to much room. This braided line hasn't failed me once, and it's the same thickness as 12 pound mono, (I got the 40 pound). The dye has come off inside the reel, but it hasn't caked up and the line is still a good solid color. I got the green, so can't say anything about the other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great braided line (can't beat the price)
customer_reviews.text: Great line! I was a bit skeptical at first about the price / quality ratio. It's true that (at first) is isn't as smooth as Suffix 832 but after a few casts it "smoothes out". Can't beat the price and I'm thrilled with the results of this braided line. Will buy for sure again.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Escalante

customer_reviews.title: This line has a spiral construction, which I think is no good.
customer_reviews.text: To my eye, this braided line has a spiral construction. I don't like it, I think it will twost3 and create wind knots. I am returning it! To be fair, I have Kastking line on a Shimano levelwind reel, and it works well. There are several types of this line, and I'm not sure which is which, or which is better. I'm going to stick with Power Pro for now... though I do get someone knots, especially right after spooling new line.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Palombo

customer_reviews.title: I got the green and it is a nice color; very stong
customer_reviews.text: Definitely got the most bang for my buck with this braided line. I have started using a baitcaster for the first time this year (i've been fishing for awhile now) and decided to make the move to more topwater baits so braid seemed the way to go. I got the green and it is a nice color; very stong. The only complaint i have was the first 3 or so trips the color/dye on the braid was dripping and flying off kind of onto my white pole/white reel and on my clothes. I am not sure if all braid does this at first, but it does not do it any longer. Tight Lines!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Please read reviews before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: The strength of the braid seems to be fine. But the bleeding of the braid is just not doing it for me. On the first fishing trip I took my two rods, one with a different brand and my second with Kastkings, I have to say it was not a good day, the bleeding was so bad I had to stop using it. Now I have to by another roll from one of the other brands. I Bought low-Viz Gray and it is the only color I have tried from kastkings. I cannot speak for the other colors. for the price you can give it a try, but I am pretty sure I won't.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, but watch out for leaking dye
customer_reviews.text: The braid casts on par with more expensive brands, knot strength is good, but the green dye gets EVERYWHERE when the line gets wet the first few times. Green thumb from braking my casts, green reel, green water splatters on my rod, and just messy in general. It all washes off with a little scrubbing but it's still annoying. For the price I will probably buy it again, but I now have to run the line through a towel before it gets to the reel the first 10-15 casts. Minor annoyance, but something I've never had trouble with across a dozen or so other brands of braid.
customer_reviews.author: Skywalker117

customer_reviews.title: For the money... hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: Been using this brand of braid for two seasons now and keep coming back to it. Though it seems a little larger in diameter than the more expensive name brand stuff, it works, & does what its supposed to. I've used several spools of it from 80lb, 40, 30 and 20. A good example is I've got some 20 on a Penn Battle 3000 and again, its a tad thicker which hinders the casting distance a tad compared to the exact reel loaded with Power Pro and same lure. Will it stop me from buying it? Nope but worth point out if you're nit picky.
customer_reviews.author: J. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great braid.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I first received the line(15# blue). The line seemed stiff compared to Power Pro, but after spooling it on reel and fishing for 4-6 hours 2 days in a row, I am very pleased. The line lays flat & smooth. It cast a mile and handled the 4#-10# northern pike with ease. Will definitely be ordering more of the KastKing braids in different #'s. Great price & quality. Will probably change over all 20+ reels to KK in time.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Talk about color bleed
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on actually touching this wear a glove. The stain used comes off easy onto hands, carpet, clothes and anything else it touches. I suppose you you are wearing gloves then it rates higher than a two star, but that totally put me off and it went into the trash. Instead I bought from a brand name and there is no bleed, so it was bitter sweet. Spent a little more and had a money back guarantee at Walmart, no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Randal Blanchette

customer_reviews.title: Poor, Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 8 lb test in 4/18. Due to health issues I didn't get to put it on my reel until 6/19. I went camping in the mountains, had put the line on my reel as per instruction. Not only did it tangle on almost every cast, when I tried pulled on my line with both hands it broke with ease. I never had line that I held onto for a year or two do this. I don't know if others found themselves in this situation. My first camping trip in 5 years and the line was useless.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G. Dowgiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Strong affordable Braid
customer_reviews.text: This fishing line works exactly as advertised. I chose this braid for it's thinner line diameter compared to other braid companies. I use this for bridge fishing in South Florida. Overall, I am very impressed. This line is strong and fairly abrasion resistant for braid. I would definitely recommend it. You can't beat the price for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: williamstrav

customer_reviews.title: Birdnested on my spinning reel, weaker than 6lb trilene mono
customer_reviews.text: Had very high hopes for this line but was very disappointed. There's a coating on it that stained my reel but that is the least of my issues. By the 7th cast it had tangled on my spool, my spinning reel spool, first time I ever got a birdnest on any spinner; so that left me with half the line on my reel, and I thought this wouldnt be an issue since its strong braided line. Unfortunately it is also the first time I've snapped braided line just from a good far cast. Removing the rest of this line tonight and respooling with a different line. Ordered proline to see how that works
customer_reviews.author: IceChillNiceThrill

customer_reviews.title: Bet you can't buy just one!
customer_reviews.text: I started off with the 30lb braid for some heavier saltwater rigs. I was so happy with the durability vs cost that I went and bought every other weight for our freshwater rigs. I've since replaced all our mono lines with braid. At this cost you can afford to swap out all your lines. I should point out that the only thing I didn't consider was that the grey and drab colors are tough to see against the water unlike monofilament, but coincidentally that makes it harder for the fish to see it too so it's a bit of a give and take.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Great braided line...Am using it for target tournament bait casting events....
customer_reviews.text: YES!! Great braided fishing line...Have bought this 15# KastKing braided line to drop onto my Pflueger Summit (1993L) bait caster to work as a tournament target casting rig. A nice line that shoots through the rod while working 5/8 plugs. I'm impressed with the fact it lays out straight and no kinks in the line. Also, I've dropped the same 15# line onto a more modern reel- ABU Garcia 4601C3. I'm planning on using the Garcia for fishing and will rig it with a heavier braid (...and, yes from KastKing) to pass some quality time on the Ocean Side pier at some point. Great product...THANX!!
customer_reviews.author: U.B. Ware

customer_reviews.title: super easy to cast
customer_reviews.text: This is my first braided line and I am very impressed. I think Im going to switch all my lines to braided. KastKing SuperPower Braided line is super strong and super easy to cast compared to my previous lines. I went out fishing for 4 days now and noticed the line is still strong with no degradation. I catches more fish than before. i did not experienced any tangle yet. definitely A MUST HAVE for fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Neil_Vals

customer_reviews.title: Good, affordable fishing line, but the color bleeds off on my hands
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product. The break strength and abrasion resistance are what you'd expect from a braided line, without the price of higher-end braided line. The downside? It bleeds all over my hands, and it stains. Simply touching won't cause it to bleed, but running the line across your hand or finger will. I ordered green, so I received lovely green lines on my hands when spooling reels, and I get green lines on my index finger when fishing. Not the worst thing in the world, as hands get dirty when fishing anyway, but worth noting. This may also cause a problem if being used for crafts or other non-fishing adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer but disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought 8lb green and put it on 4 rods for my trip to the BWCA. Over 5 days we lost countless lures and fish due to the line snapping (fishing for smaillies). I’ve used this product in the past with success but unfortunately I believe I received a faulty batch this time. The color faded very quickly and fray marks were easily visible after the first couple casts. I ended up using the braid as backing for my 6lb mono catching more pike and bass with success than I did with the braid. I may switch back to suffix832 I had that on a rod for 2 years of hard fishing without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: N.h

customer_reviews.title: My first braided line
customer_reviews.text: Kastking braided line is my first attempt at using braid. I outfitted two spinning reels with 15lbs braid and one other spinning reel with 25lbs braid I got for free for buying another Kastking product. So far I am very impressed with the line. I had to learn how to tie some new knots for using it with fluoro leaders. I look forward to outfitting some of my baitcasters in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: fourrobert13

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Braid
customer_reviews.text: This was my first brand and spool of braid I’ve ever used. I will say that it’s a great value for the money and is super durable. I purchased the 30lb test and really notice the reactions from bites, bottoms, and everything else so much more than using a traditional mono line. I’m excited to try other brands, but really have felt this is durable and can fish through anything without being torn to shreds.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Harris

customer_reviews.title: I don't really like .
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it because I wanted a hi-vis line but the diameter is much larger than the spyder wire , The weave is so coarse it feels like steel cable going through the eyes on the reel and it has a very slow sink rate " not real friendly for jig fishing , fades rather quickly . But for brute strength and being tough its great . It cuts through lily pad stems with ease .
customer_reviews.author: SherriB

customer_reviews.title: Worst braid I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I got the 20 pound test. Was replacing the line on my Penn spinfisher V. I had spider wire 20 lb invisi braid on it for 3 years. Decided it was time to change it out. Wish I had just left the old stuff on. Kastking braid ruined my night fishing. This stuff gave me more wind knots than ever. And it wasn't even windy. The line was also fragile and broke easily. I've seen some good reviews on it so thought I'd give it a try. I'll not waste any more money on this Braided line.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Best performance line and only line I use
customer_reviews.text: Best performance line and only line I use! My bass fishing arsenal is consisted of over 15 poles now and 12 of them have 20lb Super Power Braided line! This line is great for feeling the bite and never snaps! Many braid That I have used from other company will snap when you get a bad backlash or just snaps often in general. This line is strong and Does Not snap easy (found that out when I got a snag!) This line is also great for being able to fell the fish bite on the other end! Tight Lines!
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: WHAT THE CRAP IS THIS GUNK????
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is not good. The dye (moss green) from the line leaves a green film on everything it touches. I have green gunk and line smears all over my new Daiwa Tatula. NOT HAPPY AT ALL!!!! I am bormally a big fan of Kastking products but this line is just horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Yiggity

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive & does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This is the only type of braided line I have ever purchased or used on my own reels, so I can't really compare it with its competitors. That said, it is a good price and I have never experienced any sort of defects or flaws with the product. The dye does rub off when sliding against things with some pressure, like your fingers for example, but that isn't a big deal to me. I use this with a KastKing FlouroKote leader joined by an Alberto knot for most of my rod/reel setups and techniques - drop shot, texas rig, jerkbait, wacky rig. Never have a problem as long as I tie the knot well.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Z.

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as it says
customer_reviews.text: For plugging is ok for the most part 40lbs braid line. When comes to 120lbs or 100lbs it breaks between 40lbs to 54, and 55 to74lbs (120lbs). I used 3 different scales and all pointed same. I thought I might have bad batch of line. But after buying 4 spools all of them failed. I spoke with company and mailed them few feet of their line as they asked. But never heard back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom757

customer_reviews.title: Best Braid for the money hands down
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several kastking products, rods, reels and braid. Everything I've bought has been as good or much better than other name brand gear I already owned. In fact, I now compare other products to kastking which has become my go to brand. As for the Braid specifically, it has the same high quality as leading brands but at a fraction of the cost. You can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: martin g.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but ink bleeds.
customer_reviews.text: Have not tested this 20lbs yet with a carp but it seems to do just fine with medium/small sized fish. I got it because I was tired of having monofilament staying coiled and springy even after storing it for only one night. This stays almost completely straight even after keeping it in my hot car for over a month now. Only downside I've seen is that the coloring bleeds out even when it's not wet. It's not all over my reels or building up on my loops but it's slightly faded and did leave a mess on my fingers when I strung the reel.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: very small diamiter line have yet to cast with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Dacron Is Best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The 12 lb braid is a very small diameter i thought it would be tough enough but the line broke off twice at the knot well casting and the line drags on the rod guides,bad maybe if i buy the thicker diameters it would stay on better but its too costly to find out an expensive masstake on my part in my opinion DACRON Braided line hands down is the best i like the darker colors also you can get a bit creative with different colors if you like happy fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Khartoum

customer_reviews.title: Strong line.
customer_reviews.text: I've always used mono, but was suggested to try braid by my father. My fist braid was SpiderWire Ultracast Invisi-Braid. It was soft and supple, however, it frayed and snapped constantly. Bad batch? I saw KastKing and ordered it. I could immediately feel a difference. I also felt a difference when I cut my fingers trying to get the knot tight(pro tip: wrap around several fingers and don't tighten it as hard as you can). I've not had a single break that wasn't due to being snagged on a dump truck. There may be better lines, but I have no reason to look.
customer_reviews.author: Landis Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Bought the 30lb test line in low vis green, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 30lb test line in low vis green, color bleed all over my hand loading it onto my reel and would not even support 15 lbs of weight. Returned to amazon for refund. Updated: was contacted by seller who stated that they stand by their product and this was not a normal occurance and that they would be sending me out a new spool of line to try. Recieved the line 2 days later and it is much better quality holds more then the 30lbs listed. Have used it a few times so far and very happy with the line, and even more so with the company who truely stands behind their product
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: 1st time trying kastking superpower braided line
customer_reviews.text: I just received my kastking super power green moss color 6lb 327yds of braided line. I cant totally rate it with stars yet but I will definitely come back and add what I feel is right. As far as the look of the line, it's very thin but looks and feels really strong. There is about 1/8" of line on the spool they sent me, I honestly thought it was going to be more. This is my first time purchasing this line and cant wait to try it. Hoping it works great for the price of it. After I try this line out I will come back and add or edit my review for the kastking SuperPower braided line.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Used for rigging props
customer_reviews.text: Used for rigging props in theater, it is very strong, very slippery, very low stretch, no visible abrasion even after much use, not shiny. Holds knots better than monofilament, and much less stretch. Use fishing knots, but holds with 3-4 wraps, doesn't need 6. It's hard to cut with a knife or scissors. Dark blue-green color is low visibility.
customer_reviews.author: M. Luce

customer_reviews.title: it's good to go
customer_reviews.text: I paired this with the Sharky III on a 7' rod that I already had. My casting distance improved noticeably using light weight jigs and lures. Fishing a weighted jig on a worm with this line has improved feel to me meaning I can feel everything on the bottom hopefully reducing missed strikes. Not sure if I can compare this accurately against the other braided name brand line I have used for so long but it seemed to have reduced stretch and memory. Only time will tell on that aspect but for the price, it's good to go! I believe it's worth trying if you haven't already.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Very good line, great fishing line
customer_reviews.text: I used this line on my medium sized open face spinning reel. Very good line, great fishing line. I bought the 20 lb line and did some bass fishing with it. It takes a little getting used to because it is so strong for its diameter. I did used different knots for attaching to lures as it does not slide across itself like mono line does. Over all great fishing line. I will be buying some more for my other reels.
customer_reviews.author: Surf Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this line based on price and predominantly favorable reviews. I only put it on one of the two spinning reels I fished with last week. After less than a dozen casts it tangled worse than I could unravel while handling my kayak. I gave it three stars based on price and the possibility of user error. At worst it will make adequate backing for my higher priced braids.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Like really strong thread...
customer_reviews.text: What’s on this stuff? And why? Just curious. Reminds me of some stunt kite string I had years ago. Tough stuff. Might cut you. Feels and reacts like a fine sewing thread. Spooling it on and tieing my first knots was tricky. We’ll see how it does on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Turner

customer_reviews.title: Seems to cast a lot further than SpiderWire at a similar size and the yellow color makes it easy for me to detect light strikes
customer_reviews.text: Man, this product ... this company ... what can I say? I bought a Summer spinning reel last year and have used it several times a week without issue. Spooled it and a baitcaster up last week with the SuperPower braid and had ZERO issues (other than my own stupidity not watching for wind loops). Seems to cast a lot further than SpiderWire at a similar size and the yellow color makes it easy for me to detect light strikes. My new braid of choice!
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Kastking braided, in fact I'm a KastKing's products fan since the very first time I bought a SuperPower low-vis 50 lbs. It's been almost a year of monthly use and need no replace - I'm a regular beach angler. A bunch of catches, some 6 to 10 kls, some "just for a picture" and the line woks great even after a year of use. 100% recommended. I'm using KastKing 15 lbs, 20 lbs, 25 lbs, 30 lbs and 50 lbs -all braided lines- in different reels and only good things to say.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Cordoba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Casting, Excellent Strength, Excellent Color, Extreme Value
customer_reviews.text: Color is excellent in helping detect bites, especially on the fall. Color lasts in fresh water.....a little bit less in saltwater. I am a huge fan of Kastking products and I’ve purchased this braid in at least 4 sizes. In addition.....I tie on KK Fluorokote as leader material. I caught a 40” Ray the other day on this combination (both 20lb) on my Brutus rod w/KK Eagle reel and it handled flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: rshower2

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: Loaded this up on some Penn Conflict 5000 spinners. Not sure if this is thick, but the reels didn't hold as much as they were supposed to. Can't talk about durability or color fastness yet, but I have the same line in a couple other colors on different reels and it is holding up fine. It will get 5 stars until it disappoints me!
customer_reviews.author: Tony in PBG

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've used the moss green 20lb braid on ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used the moss green 20lb braid on a baitcaster type reel and have had a great experience so far. Little or no stretch, smooth casting and reeling, great feel with a tight tine. This has been spooled on a spinning reel that claims to hold 285 meters of 0.18mm line. I only got about 120yds on it. Not sure if the line diameter is thicker than advertised or if the cheap reel is the culprit. My guess is the reel. Either way, I have yet to get this in the water, but expect it to perform as well as the moss green.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F.

customer_reviews.title: Great fishing line and great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I recently took my reel with this new braided line to Kodiak for a 10 day fishing trip. I was very impressed with the toughness of this line. More importantly this line is very easy to tie knots because of it's suppleness. There is no comparison to mono. I will probably never use mono again. The price is reasonable and is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Dave

customer_reviews.title: Can’t feel bites over 600 feet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 80# test line to use for deep dropping with electric reels. When fishing 600-1200 feet deep, you need line that is very sensitive and has zero stretch to feel fish biting that deep. This line does not perform well for my application. Bites are almost impossible to feel with this line whereas 80# PowerPro let’s you feel the smallest nibbles. I actually reeled a fish in not knowing he was on.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McCarver

customer_reviews.title: No brainer, get on board and save some $$$
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the real deal. Decided to give it a try after not wanting to pay what some of the competitors are charging. The only issue I’ve seen, is the clot does bleed a little when spooling the line on the first time. So just be careful what is nearby. Despite that, long term the color holds up at least as well as PowerPro. Like it enough, that I’ve bought two more spools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Compared to power pro slick, my normal line, this is very loud. I caught a nice trout and thought I was running a small chain saw.. this may be cheaper by almost 50% over power pro slick.. but the noise through the guides is just too annoying. I saw some compare on youtube and the test looked great.. if you dont' mind the noise this is not bad stuff from what I saw.. I won't replace when this wears out.... will stick to power pro slick
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Id buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: I went fishing this past weekend, and this line is great! I re-spooled the same day i got it and went fishing on Saturday. Casting went so smooth, no knots, no tangling, I don't have a spooling machine so I usually make my own setup to spool it. Unfortunately I didn't catch any keepers, but none the less this line held up well. I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JTF

customer_reviews.title: It's the real deal
customer_reviews.text: I took this out twice to tryout on my new Diawa BG and it was my first braided line experience. I got snagged up 7 times during a total of 15 hours of fishing for 2 days off of my local pier. Every time I got snagged and pulled to break loose only my 20lb fluorocarbone leader broke or nothing at all! I still haven't seen this line or a knot tied with it fail and that is impressive! I went to new bait shop that sold other stuff for $43 while I waited to receive SuperPower. Smart choice by me and you too if you order it trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Conquer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR BEADING TOO!  Excellent quality and quantity for less $$ Very thin and strong!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this line to do seed bead stringing and beads weaving for the color and thinness for almost 3 times as much thread/roll for a few dollars more than the Spider Wire I purchased. I found it doesn't fray after multiple passes thru 15/0 seed beads or break from friction (so far) from the Swarovski crystals I used. This shade of green is virtually invisible even in my lightest beads. I look forward to trying the tropical color and testing the 4lb test line soon! I would compare this to the Fireline brand by Berkley. I Hope this helps other beaders looking for a great prices fishing line in a larger spool size.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Goetz

customer_reviews.title: Crap Line Breaks At Random!
customer_reviews.text: This line is garbage. When slight pressure is applied (WAY BELOW the stated “30” lb test), the line breaks at random spots (not at my knots) without warning. Lost several rigs and lures ON TWO SEPARATE BRAND NEW RODS AND REELS that I spooled up with this crap. Going back to Power Pro, a QUALITY line.
customer_reviews.author: Finest Kind

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Casting and Retrieval
customer_reviews.text: Best fishing line I have ever used. I don’t know if it is my imagination or not but, the line seems to make my lures perform better. I don’t know but, it is so much smoother than monofilament line. I’m sure not everyone will agree but, for me the braided line is the best I have ever used. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: LuvDrones

customer_reviews.title: Found line had been spliced together  2 times
customer_reviews.text: Let me just start out saying i have been a spiderwire guy for years i seen this braid on amazon thought i would give it a try i bought 1097yrd roll for a vacation trip coming up this May so today i took the cover off my boat grab a few reels and starting re lining on the 2nd reel about 75yrd in i found that 2lines had been tied together as if the rann out on 1 reel and started another one striped line off and started over got about 120yrd on a same thing another knot.... sorry Kast King never again..
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Must b defective
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price but I've had this line break off more then once on quite a few casts and it's caused me to lose a few amazing lures. For a line with such a high test idk if it's defective or what but I wouldn't buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Joseph virgona

customer_reviews.title: 12lb not so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for bass fishing, it constantly breaks with no damage to the line. Shiner fishing with floro leader the braid breaks before leader every time, it breaks in weird spots, during the hook set it has broke a foot above the leader Knot, it's broke 20 yards above the leader makes no sense except week spots during the making process. I have lost a lot of fish due to this line and gear, won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

product_meta.title: KastKing SuperPower Braided Fishing Line - Abrasion Resistant Braided Lines – Incredible Superline – Zero Stretch – Smaller Diameter – A Must-Have!
product_meta.description: KastKing SuperPower braid line is a fishing line like no other! Our braided fishing lines are designed for increased casting distance and durability. You don’t have to worry about fraying or break-offs. KastKing SuperPower MultiTuf PE Line Braid (Ultra High Molecular Weight Polyethylene Braid Fiber) is made with same durable fiber that bullet proof vests are made from. Affordable KastKing SuperPower Braid fishing line comes in test strength ranging from 10 -150 Ib test, with many fade resisting colors available such as grey, green, multicolor, blue, white, pink and yellow. KastKing SuperPower braid fishing line is made with 4 high strength strands, while the higher tensile strength of 65lb-150lb has 8 powerful strands for even more smooth power. Our dynamic 8-strand line is wrapped tighter than our competitor’s line for a smaller profile resulting in better casting and knot strength. There’s no longer any reason to overpay for high-quality braided fishing lines anymore. Whether you are fishing freshwater or saltwater, surf fishing, ice fishing, trout fishing or bass fishing, you can count on KastKing braid to become your next favorite braided fishing lines! KastKing is an ICAST Best of Show Award Winning Brand. KastKing keeps fishing fun by keeping it affordable.
feature_bullets: Strong knot strength - dynamically incorporated strands in Casting Superpower braided lines allow you to easily tie a more solid knot; you can even tie an improved clinch knot.
Low memory - helps you achieve a better, farther casts, less chance of wind Knots
Greater abrasion resistance - of Casting braided fishing line decreases the likelihood of losing your "big one"! Casting Superpower Braid line's powers are. . . Super!
Ultra-high sensitivity & Zero stretch - for superior hook setting that increases your catch ratio.
Smaller diameter - compared to other brands allowing you to spool more fishing line on to your reel.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
